reviews.review_msg: I'm sorry but this class is absurd online. I wish I'd taken the campus version.

I took POL 471 when it was split with grad students.  Basically, we undergrads did the same amount of work as graduate students and the seminar/course was run like  a grad  class.  For marking purposes, I don't think we were fairly distinguished from graduate students.

Interesting prof but expectations are a bit unrealistic.  He calls on people in class,  this is how he runs the seminar and you are expected to have ready every single reading in depth...not always possible with a full course load.  Unless you have the time to be really really well prepared...avoid!
I prefer this prof in person.  Nice guy but this course was absurd online.

Decent class, for a guy who is completely in the dark about the subject, he makes the material quite accessible. Nice guy, I wonder how he is able to take so much crap from students in the distance education course.
Very smart guy.  I learned a lot in his class.  Had to work hard for my grade but was well worth it.

I had the privilege to take Pol. 327 with professor McBride in class instead of online.  He is a wonderful professor with a great depth of knowledge.  His expectations of us as his students was quite high and the workload a bit hefty but nonetheless, the hard work was definitely worth it.  Do not take if you are a slacker,looking for an easy grade.
an easy B - A.

Good news everybody! YOU DON'T HAVE TO GO TO LECTURE AT ALL! I stopped going to class after three lectures cause it was boring and scattered. His exams are 100% from the book and I got an A without using any of his lecture notes. You HAVE to read the book and read it thoroughly. No offense to Mcbride, he's a nice guy he's just not that interesting.
i took this course as distance ed. the materials were okay and this course seemed easy. But it was not! although i did all the assignment and readings. I would not recommend distance-ed.

DEFINITELY not for slackers.  Very dense course and it is REQUIRED that you do the readings.  He seems to be very passionate about what he teaches, but tends to move very slowly during lecture and tries to cram everything at the very end.  Ultra boring class if you're not into politics.
13 classes = 26 hours of solitare on my laptop.
He's a really nice guy and knowledgeable but lectures are pretty bland. The text is really easy to follow and most of the content is interesting. Pray for a good TA because they mark everything.

POL 100 with McBride is very easy. Make sure you show up to class and do the readings and that's about as much work you need to do. He's very knowledable but he makes lectures quite dry. The best thing about the course is the textbook. It's very well written and content is extremely useful and informative.
Very knowledgeable prof, if you have an interest in political science and you do the readings you will do fine..Not for slackers

Good prof. He is  clear to understand and is considerate.  There are lots of readings for the course but that is what is required at upper level. One drawback of this course is the TA, is an extreme lefty, which I considered myself too, but I do apprecriate balance and fair marking...so make sure your writing is against neoliberalism.

He is a good prof knows what he is teaching but his notes are very unorganized. Tends to do the lecture and whenever he feels like puts down a few notes here and there. Mid term and final was brutal. Also the term paper was pretty hard 2300words for intro course.

Course material was well written and highly intersting.  Stephen's been around for a long time and it shows in the quality of his work.  Course required a heavy paper and a brutal final exam, which seems standard for his courses.  Good prof, but be prepared to work!

The midterm is a nightmare because it is based upon the reading from the first half of the semester. The questions are very pointless. For example, the midterm asks, "How many countries are in the EU in 1998?" Also, he used TURNITIN. Thankyou for this introduction to Political Science, I am not going to take any more Political Science after this.
Lectures were boring. Informative, though I survived without going or paying attention to half of the classes. Books used were pretty easy to read, so keeping up with the class isn't too challenging.

Lectures were a colossal waste of time. SOOOOO boring and dry. None of his writing is legible nore do lectures have any flow to them. I think half the lecture was silence as he thought about what to say next. Final was 4 full essays in 3 hour period. I would say to avoid him if you want to leave the course with any interest in political science!

Awesome Prof.... one of the best courses i have taken thus far... lectures were kinda dry but then again i dont blame him as the content was intro and basic... midterm straight from texts/ccw!!! essays topics very simple!!! Finals 4/13 essays.... you choose 4 of the 13 topics... very easy as he told us ahead of time what is going to be on the exam

Notes very disorganized, but lecs make them clear enough to be understood. Does not cover lots of material during lectures, so READ txt (Very clear. covers most stuff). Don't skip lecs because he may cover detail that text does not. MT is 60+ MC and some para Q's. Final is 4 Essays!  Guarantee pass w/ ok grade if put some effort but hard to get A.

Boring class, his lectures stem from the textbook so you're probably OK with just skipping most of the lectures if you're willing to keep up with the readings. A reasonable amount of readings, and his class seems alright. Challenging, though manageable.

Talk about boring lectures. Awful! Watching paint dry would teach you more about political science. His mid term, taken directly from the textbook, wasn't that easy, nor was his final. However, the term paper topics were pretty good. All that being said he ruined political science for me and I don't plan on ever taking another one again. Boring!

If u need a good nap, his lectures are the place to be. just bring a blanket and curl up to this slow-paced and humdrum voice. He records his lectures and has them available, so i suggest you increase the play speed setting to about 1.4x then he'll speak at your pace. midterm was directly from the text and courseware, final inspired by lectures

Very dry lectures- it could have been so interesting but he made it very hard to listen to or care about. He was never open to any other opinion other than his own. I felt sorry for the Americans in the class.

Took 327 online. The material is well organized and presented. However, if you get Andrew Phillips as TM he is of no help at all. Unfortunately, Professor McBride was absent all summer and the course was essentially delivered by an MA student who doesn't read assignments (according to another TA I know).

I took his distance course. I'm glad that he doesn't believe in "objectivity", students are welcome to counter his arguments. I enjoyed his readings. He did have an assignment where you have to support economic globalization, so it's not as "unbalanced" as some say. I thought he was fairly clear.

Good guy, not to hard on marking.  The class amazed me though.  It really changed my political view points on many topics.  I started off as a moderate conservative and left the class wearing an NDP banner.

The professor was too unbalanced in his approach for my liking and was not very objective in "teaching" the subject. If you want to be indoctrinated rather than thought than this is the class and professor for you. All in all, I would not recommend the professor nor the class. Taking an IPE class would be more engaging and much more informative.

Overall, good professor. Seems a little distant/cold/un-interested when talking to him-- but his lectures are fairly interesting-- he does poke fun at the right, though. So, any neocons going into his class can expect to be disappointed. For the rest of us, his jabs at the right are pretty funny.
Can't attest to his teaching ability but he's very tardy with marking assignments and doesn't mark fairly. He actually responded well to my Keynes bashing interestingly enough.

If you enjoy being spoon-fed Keynesian propaganda, you'll enjoy this course. His essay questions are framed implicitly presuming that "labour movement" arguments are infallible. If you enjoy Michael Moore's work, take this course.
Good prof; some find his lectures boring, probably because of his soft voice, but if you listen to what he has to say he has a lot to teach you.

disregard the last comment. great class! the guy is definitely on the ball and is definitely one of the smarter profs in the faculty. highly approachable and gives specific feedback instead of wacking around the bush. definitely worth takin'
He is rather cold and unhelpful.
This guy is great.
Even though Dr. McBride and I are at opposite ends of the political spectrum, he made his points very well. He and Dr. Busumtwi-Sam are (arguably) most intelligent in faculty.
So awsome. This was the most valuable polisci I've ever taken. I learned a lot.
I need to go protest something!
He is a great teacher!
